cz.ive.gui
Class AnimatedPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cz.ive.gui.AnimatedPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Gui, Subwindow, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
ZoomScrollPanel
public abstract class AnimatedPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Gui, Subwindow

Abstract implementation of GUI panel, that supports backbuffer and its filling from another thread

Author:
Ondra
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

paint

public void paint()
Fills the offscreen buffer. This method is supposed to be called from the simulation thread, when the world is in a consistent state. This method is threadsafe.

Specified by:
paint in interface Gui

render

protected abstract void render()
This method is meant to be overidden by subclasses in order to render the simulation state. This method is not threadsafe. It is called from paint method.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Main Swing painting method. This method just copies contents of the offscreen buffer to the screen (onto this component).

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - Graphics representing this component's canvas

public Info getInfo()
Retrives Info for this Subwindow.

Returns:
Info filled with data about this Subwindow

canAccept

public Info canAccept(java.lang.Object object)
Query wether this Subwindow accepts (can view) a given Object.

Specified by:
canAccept in interface Subwindow
Parameters:
object - that is being offered.
Returns:
Info representing action with the object if it can be accepted or null if not.

contain

public boolean contain(java.lang.Object object)
Does the subwindow already contain a given object?

Specified by:
contain in interface Subwindow
Parameters:
object - that is querried.
Returns:
true iff the object is already viewed by this window.

accept

public void accept(java.lang.Object object)
Accept (view) the object. This can be called only after successfull call to canAccept.

Specified by:
accept in interface Subwindow
Parameters:
object - that is being offered.

getPanel

public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
Retrives root panel of this Subwindow. It is not necessarilly this class, for example in case that we use some ToolBars and other controls. So whenever the Subwindow component is to be added to some container, the panel return by this call should be added instead of instance of this class.

Specified by:
getPanel in interface Subwindow
Returns:
root panel of this GUI component

setInvisible

public void setInvisible(boolean invisible)
Marks this Subwindow as invisible. That means it does not have to update itsef.

Specified by:
setInvisible in interface Subwindow
Parameters:
invisible - true iff this Subwindow is not currently on the screen.

isInvisible

public boolean isInvisible()
Is this Subwindow invisible?

Specified by:
isInvisible in interface Subwindow
Returns:
true iff this Subwindow is not currently on the screen.

revalidateSubwindow

public boolean revalidateSubwindow()
Forces the Subwindow to revalidate its contents. This is called when major parts of current simulation were changed (e.g. after a load).

Specified by:
revalidateSubwindow in interface Subwindow
Returns:
true iff the subwindow should be closed, since its contents are not valid any more.
